title: Obed Wild & Scenic River: Archive
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News     News Releases     Archive                Archive           Subscribe  | What is RSS     April 13, 2016  Annual Obed Clean-Up & Volunteer Appreciation Potluck Lunch  Volunteers share their time and talents and are worth their weight in gold.   April 07, 2016  Find Your Park During National Park Week 2016  National Park Week will kick off with free backcountry camping permits at both parks as well as free camping at select campgrounds.   March 25, 2016  Potters Falls Hemlock Treatment Workshop and Clean-Up  This free workshop will teach local landowners how to protect hemlock trees from the deadly Hemlock Woolly Adelgid.   February 12, 2016  Healthy Hike: Cumberland Trail Section to Alley Ford, February 27  Get out and explore YOUR Obed Wild & Scenic River. In celebration of the National Park Service Centennial, Obed is conducting a healthy hike along the Cumberland Trail section to Alley Ford on Saturday, February 27.   October 13, 2015  Big South Fork and Obed Waive Some Fees for Veteran’s Day  On Veterans Day, or any day, honor those that have served and sacrificed for our country.   September 22, 2015  Find Your Park: Obed WSR & Big South Fork NRRA to Celebrate National Public Lands Day on September 26  Get outdoors and take part in the celebration for National Public Lands Day 2015.   September 16, 2015  Obed Wild & Scenic River Welcomes Fourth Grade Students Through “Every Kid In a Park” Initiative  The goal of the Every Kid in a Park program is to connect fourth graders with the great outdoors.   September 16, 2015  Hog Hunting Permits for Big South Fork and Obed Go on Sale Starting September 26  The permit costs $5.00 and is good for both Big South Fork and Obed.   August 31, 2015  Obed Primitive Bow Workshop on September 18  Participants still have time to put some work in on the nearly finished bow and its sister bow.   August 28, 2015  Obed Adopt-a-Crag Celebrates National Public Lands Day on September 12, 2015  Volunteers are needed to help with several projects such as general trail maintenance and litter pickup. August 10, 2015  Obed Primitive Bow Workshop on August 14  This program marks the one year anniversary of the Obed Wild and Scenic River's primitive bow workshops.   August 10, 2015  Art in the Park Reception: 2015 Photo Contest Winners Will Be Unveiled!  The event will include a display of photographs from the recent Obed photography contest.   July 27, 2015  Find Your Park: Big South Fork and Obed to Celebrate the National Park Service’s 99th Birthday on August 25  Visitors are encouraged to celebrate all that America's more than 400 national parks have to offer and try something new.   July 17, 2015  Obed Coffee and Climb with a Ranger Programs on Saturday, August 1  This program is an opportunity for those who want to try the sport of rock climbing but did not know where to begin.   July 17, 2015  “Once in a Blue Moon” Night Sky Event at the Obed on July 31  All ages are welcome to attend this free event. May 26, 2015  Fish with a Ranger at the Obed on June 6  To participate in Fish with a Ranger, meet at Lilly Bridge at 7 a.m. (EDT).   May 08, 2015  Rangers Hall, Hudson, and Painter Receive National Valor Award  The award was bestowed for an incident that started around midnight on May 11, 2014.   May 01, 2015  Primitive Bow Workshop at Obed Visitor Center on May 14  The workshop is wheelchair accessible.   May 01, 2015  Obed Rock Climbing and Paddling Program for Sixth Grade Homeschooled Students on May 18  Students spend an entire day with National Park Service rangers.   May 01, 2015  Bill Harper to be Featured at Memories of the Obed on Saturday, May 9  Each month a different speaker shares their memories of life in the vicinity of the river   April 27, 2015  Annual Obed Clean Up and Volunteer Appreciation Potluck Lunch on Saturday, May 16, 2015  Volunteers share their time and talents and are worth their weight in gold.   April 23, 2015  2014 Tourism to Obed WSR Created $3.7 Million in Economic Benefits  A new National Park Service report shows that approximately 216,000 visitors to Obed Wild & Scenic River in 2014, spent $3.7 million in communities near the park. That spending supported 46 jobs in the local area and had a cumulative benefit to the local economy.   April 23, 2015  Obed Wild and Scenic River Announces Junior Ranger Program to Celebrate National Junior Ranger Day  No reservations are required.   April 23, 2015  Big South Fork and Obed Trails Highlighted in the Mountain Laurel Walks Celebration  The Mountain Laurel Walks is an annual celebration of late spring in the Upper Cumberland Plateau.
